intro: Ayapana triplinervis, commonly known as the three-veined ayapana, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its palmate leaves with three distinct veins, giving it its scientific name. Its showy flowers are typically pink or purple and attract various pollinators. Ayapana triplinervis is often found in moist, shaded environments such as rainforests and along riverbanks.
